org.codehaus.preon.el
Class Expressions

java.lang.Object
  org.codehaus.preon.el.Expressions

public class Expressions
extends Object

A convenience class for creating Expressions.

Author:
Wilfred Springer

Constructor Detail

Expressions

public Expressions()
Method Detail

createBoolean

public static <E> Expression<Boolean,E> createBoolean(ReferenceContext<E> context,
                                                      String expr)
                                           throws InvalidExpressionException
Creates an Expression from the Limbo expression passed in. (Will fail if the expression passed in does not return a boolean value.)

Type Parameters:
E - The type of environment that will be passed in when evaluating the expression.
Parameters:
context - The context for this expression.
expr - The Limbo expression.
Returns:
An Expression object that can be evaluated against instances of E.
Throws:
InvalidExpressionException - If the expression cannot be created. (Either because references can not be bound to the context, or because the parser fails to parse the Limbo expression.)

create

public static <E> Expression<Object,E> create(ReferenceContext<E> context,
                                              String expr)

createInteger

public static <E> Expression<Integer,E> createInteger(ReferenceContext<E> context,
                                                      String expr)
                                           throws InvalidExpressionException
Creates an Expression from the Limbo expression passed in. (Will fail if the expression passed in does not return a integer value.)

Type Parameters:
E - The type of environment that will be passed in when evaluating the expression.
Parameters:
context - The context for this expression.
expr - The Limbo expression.
Returns:
An Expression object that can be evaluated against instances of E.
Throws:
InvalidExpressionException - If the expression cannot be created. (Either because references can not be bound to the context, or because the parser fails to parse the Limbo expression.)

createInteger

public static <E> Expression<Integer,E> createInteger(int value,
                                                      Class<E> cl)
Creates an Expression wrapping around a number.

Type Parameters:
E - The type of context to which this expression should be applied.
Parameters:
value - The value to be wrapped.
cl - The type of context expected by the Expression.
Returns:
An Expression evaluating to value.

from

public static <C> Expressions.ContextualizedExpressionBuilder<C> from(Class<C> contextType)

from

public static <C> Expressions.BoundExpressionBuilder<C> from(ReferenceContext<C> contextType)

multiply

public static <C> Expression<Integer,C> multiply(Expression<Integer,C> first,
                                                 Expression<Integer,C> second)
Returns a new expression, representing the multiplication of the two Expressions passed in.

Type Parameters:
C - The type of context of the expressions.
Parameters:
first - The first expression.
second - The second expression.
Returns:
A new Expression, representing the multiplication of the two arguments passed in. Returns null if either one of the arguments is null.

add

public static <C> Expression<Integer,C> add(Expression<Integer,C> first,
                                            Expression<Integer,C> second)
Returns a new expression, representing the sum of the two Expressions passed in.

Type Parameters:
C - The type of context of the expressions.
Parameters:
first - The first expression.
second - The second expression.
Returns:
A new Expression, representing the sum of the two arguments passed in. Returns null if either one of the arguments is null.
